headline: These Five Stocks Had Their Worst Year in Decades
summary: Pressures including U.S. tariffs, AI-related disruption and more pummeled five companies in 2025 to the point that they had their worst annual performance in at least 20 years, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Drinks-maker Constellation Brands’ 37% drop puts it on pace for its worst loss since 1987.  Brown & Brown’s 22% tumble is on track to be the insurer’s toughest year since 1990.

headline: Deckers UGG Continues to Drive Revenue With International Strength
summary: DECK's UGG brand outpaces company growth in Q2, driven by strong wholesale demand and accelerating international momentum.

headline: Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: Deckers Brands, Nike, On Holdings and Align Technology
summary: Deckers Brands and Align Technology headline two S&P 500 stocks down 50%-80% from highs, with solid balance sheets and growth outlooks heading into 2026.
